title: Why Nintendo?
description: The original Nintendo Entertainment System was off the hook.

title: Adventure
description: This game for the Atari 2600 contained the first easter egg in a video game.

title: Fippy Darkpaw
description: This NPC has spawned millions of times in Everquest following millions of deaths.  How????

title: Mario Appeared Where?
description: Nintendo's main man, Mario, actually first appeared in the arcade game Donkey Kong on July 9, 1981, and he went by the name Jumpman.

title: Mario's First Pet
description: In this game, Donkey Kong was actually Mario's pet ape who escapes and kidnaps Mario's girlfriend, Pauline.

title: Mario's Original Job
description: When Mario made his debut in this game, his profession was a carpenter since the game took place at a construction site. It wasn't until Mario Bros. that Mario made the career change to plumber, as much of this game took place underground.

title: A 1983 Popular Baby Name
description: Due to the popularity of the Mario Bros. game in 1983 there was a huge increase in the number of people naming their children Mario during that time.

title: $500 Starts Atari!
description: Nolan Bushnell and Ted Dabney started Atari with just $500. Within 5 years the company earned $28 million, and by 1982, sales topped $2 billion.

title: Atari and Chuck E. Cheese
description: In addition to starting Atari, Nolan Bushnell also founded the popular pizza and entertainment company, Chuck E. Cheese.

title: Bowser: An Ox or a Turtle?
description: Bowser, the main antagonist of Nintendoâ€™s Mario franchise, was originally envisioned to be an ox. This is probably why he has horns and a defined snout, even though he is a turtle.

title: Worst Video Game EVER!!!!
description: Atari's E.T. the Extra Terrestrial is largely considered the worst video game of all time.

title: Where Did E.T. Go???
description: The urban legend - that turned out to be true - was that Atari had so many unsold copies [of E.T. the Extra Terrestrial] that they buried them in the desert. A documentary crew actually went out and dug them up!
